alert.note: Alert for Glacier; Pondera; Toole (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following counties, Glacier, Pondera and Toole. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 814 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over portions of the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cut Bank, Conrad, Valier, Ethridge and Santa Rita. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
